cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SE of Grand Cayman
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the northwest Caribbean, forecast to cross western Cuba Friday, enter the central Gulf Saturday, and then curve NNW-N toward the south-central Louisiana coast by Sunday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast (around Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: No watches in effect along the U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.warning_coast: No warnings along the U.S. Gulf Coast as of Advisory #2
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward across Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–55 mph) possible late Sunday into Monday with higher gusts if the core tracks slightly west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push water levels 2–4 ft above normal around Sabine Pass and lower Neches River if the track shifts westward.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–6 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible Sunday–Monday, bringing flash-flood risk to the Beaumont/Port Arthur area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend; possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands Sunday night/Monday.
